results.title: Don't be the last to know
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Film Australia and Aviva Ziegler
results.brief_description: Introduced by Mike Willesee - this video provides an in-depth look at two Australian families and their fight against drug addiction. Typical families with day to day problems like everyone else - until a serious drug problem surfaced. Addicts and their families speak frankly about their frustration, confusion and the courage needed to fight back. Essential viewing for all parents.

results.title: Don't be a dummy
results.creator_credit: Oswald Skilbeck, Verity Films, Central Electric Authority and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: Details of safety precautions to be taken in certain operations and maintenance work associated with electricity generating stations, the underlying principle being the permit-to-work. Deals with such things as towing ropes, coal bunkers, and conveyors, boiler blow-down valves, and jib and overhead cranes and trucks.

results.title: Don't be a bloody idiot!
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian Film Corporation, Tasmania. Police Dept. and Edwin Moses
results.brief_description: What to do and what not to do when planning a trip into the Australian bush. Looks at safety and essential equipment. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Don't
results.brief_description: Shows the precarious life history of a butterfly as it struggles to survive and grow to maturity in the hostile environment of nature and man. Without narration - music soundtrack only. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Domestic violence
results.brief_description: This sensitive program is presented by Victoria Nicolls. It covers the myths surrounding domestic violence, whether the police can help, what the law is, how women have suffered, whether men can change, the effects on children, the secrecy and how some women have survived. In the program we meet victims, refuge workers, counsellors and police who discuss domestic violence.

results.title: Domestic solar water heating
results.brief_description: Discusses the benefits of domestic applications of solar water heating. Detailed illustrations of how to install solar heating systems, coupled with statistics on energy savings make the film a practical and attractive resource for home-owners.

results.title: Dolly
results.creator_credit: Mosfilm, Isaac Fridberg and Igor Ageev
results.brief_description: Tanya is a brilliant gymnast. Selected while still a small child to be given the training needed to be an international champion, she grows up in an atmosphere of tense and unfriendly rivalry, arrogance and a desire to win at all costs. Disaster strikes at the age of fourteen when an injury brings her career to an end and she is shunted off into the normal world. A controversial and powerful drama about the Soviet system of making and breaking sporting champions. Based on a story by Igor Ageev.

results.title: Dolls of many lands
results.brief_description: Shows dolls exhibited at an international fair and now permanently housed in a famous collection in Italy. The dolls are dressed in folk costumes and are shown in settings which closely resemble some characteristic natural background of the doll’s native land. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Dolls (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: MacMillan Film Productions, Pre-School Education Project and G.A. Howe
results.brief_description: Indicates how realistic play with dolls helps children learn about human relationships and come to terms with babies in their own families. The class watches while a child’s mother washes and dresses her baby and the children copy her with their dolls.
